key_dates.description: Cycle turning point - potential reversal or continuation signal
Cycle turning point - key date with statistical significance (85% up)
Cycle turning point - statistical significance (90% up on June 30)
Cycle turning point - potential reversal zone

seasonal: June is a slightly bearish month for the S&P 500. However, this month is part of a critical historical cycle window. The week of June 9-13 and the period of June 20 are expected to be particularly important weekly cycles. Most cycles signal expected peaks between June 16-21, with potential declines in the second half of the month.

statistics.description: Over the last 30 years, the index closed higher on June 16 approximately 85% of the time
Over the last 30 years, the index declined around June 24 approximately 71% of the time
Over the last 30 years, the index closed higher on June 30 approximately 90% of the time
In the last 30 years, the index closed higher on June 17 than it was on June 11, in 73% of cases (22 out of 30)

insights: June 2025 is a historically critical month - it sits at the intersection of 82-year and 164-year war/revolution cycles (82 years from WWII, 164 years from the US Civil War)
Trump's birthday is June 14 - Fibonacci ratio 61.8 years from JFK assassination in November 1963 points to September 2025, suggesting a politically charged period beginning in June
Presidential assassination attempts have historically clustered in June/July at distinct cyclical intervals, indicating June 2025 could be a tipping point for deep political/social change
Fear & Greed Index at 62 (Greed zone) at start of month - when above 'Greed', expect a correction; when hitting 'Fear', look for buying opportunities
The V-shaped recovery pattern in recent months is one of the most challenging for technical analysis - sharp drop followed by equally sharp recovery with no classic resistance pause
5,700-5,775 zone is a critical technical resistance area where the 20 and 50 week moving averages converge - potential double top formation
The week ending June 20 is expected to produce multiple cycle convergences, and daily cycles between June 9-12 suggest heightened volatility
Despite broad index recovery, the Russell 2000 (small caps) has barely recovered - a Dow Theory divergence warning of market weakness
Timing is everything: combine price action with cycle dates, looking for technical levels (support/resistance) aligning with turning points for highest probability trades
The weekly cycle ending June 27 and several daily dates between June 20-30 point to expected volatility in the last third of the month

support.description: Major support zone - convergence of 20 and 50 week moving averages; key level from recent cycle
Secondary support within the 5,700-5,775 cluster; held during recent tests
Deep support target if monthly retracement unfolds (similar to March-April area)

resistance.description: Also acts as resistance band - the index has been oscillating around this zone, creating a potential double top
All-time high area from the December/February peaks; significant overhead resistance

technical.indicators: Weekly chart shows a V-shaped recovery which is difficult to analyze. The 20-week and 200-day moving averages are converging in the 5,700-5,775 zone. Daily chart shows a half-mast flag/pennant pattern within an uptrend. Fear & Greed at 62 suggests caution. Low volumes on rallies while small caps lag - classic divergence signal. MACD and RSI not confirming breakout strength. The index has returned to near all-time highs but internal breadth is poor - a Charles Dow disharmony warning.

summary: June 2025 is flagged as an exceptionally significant month for the S&P 500, sitting at the intersection of deep historical cycles (82-year and 164-year war cycles). Key turning dates cluster around June 4, 10-11, 16, 23, and 27. The report favors a scenario where the market may rally into mid-June (16th has 85% upside probability) before a potential correction into late June (24th has 71% downside probability), with a strong end-of-month bounce (30th at 90% up). Technical resistance at 5,700-5,775 and poor market breadth (Russell 2000 divergence) add cautionary weight.
previous_month_review: May 2025 had five turning dates with one (May 9) nearly missed by a day or two: May 2 marked the high of the movement, May 9 did not serve as a turning point (missed the low), May 16 acted as the high of the previous cycle and started a downward move, May 22-27 were a double cycle where the May 23 date marked the low and beginning of an upward cycle. Overall the month was very successful from a cycles perspective.
risk_notes: June is a slightly bearish month seasonally - trade with caution and respect the overall trend direction
Geopolitical risk is elevated: deep historical cycles suggest potential for dramatic political events (US political upheaval/Trump-related events around his June 14 birthday)
The V-shape recovery pattern is treacherous - a reversal from current levels without proper consolidation could be sharp
Russell 2000 / small cap divergence from large cap recovery is a Dow Theory warning of potential broader market weakness
Consider reducing exposure to leveraged instruments (2x-3x) as cycle volatility could produce whipsaws
If the 5,700-5,775 support zone breaks, expect potential revisit of the 4,800 area
This is NOT investment advice - information is for educational purposes. Connect with the Discord community for real-time updates
When trading against the general trend, only enter after clear technical confirmation on intraday charts (4h, 30min)
